html: The #MOMMAAct is a bill I’ve intro'd w/@SenDuckworth & @RepRobinKelly to address & reduce maternal deaths, especially for moms & babies of color, who are at heightened risk. We have to ask ourselves what we need to do as a country so mothers & infants can survive pregnancies.
text: The #MOMMAAct is a bill I’ve intro'd w/@SenDuckworth & @RepRobinKelly to address & reduce maternal deaths, especially for moms & babies of color, who are at heightened risk. We have to ask ourselves what we need to do as a country so mothers & infants can survive pregnancies.

html: Regardless of what one thinks about abortion, shouldn’t we be holding hearings and developing solutions on these unacceptable maternal and infant mortality rates?
text: Regardless of what one thinks about abortion, shouldn’t we be holding hearings and developing solutions on these unacceptable maternal and infant mortality rates?

html: No nation as rich and advanced as the United States should have new moms and infants—especially women and babies of color—dying at the rates we are currently seeing. It is a national tragedy.
text: No nation as rich and advanced as the United States should have new moms and infants—especially women and babies of color—dying at the rates we are currently seeing. It is a national tragedy.

html: The U.S. is one of only 13 countries where rates of maternal mortality are worse today than they were 25 years ago. The U.S. also ranks 32nd out of 35 of the richest nations in the deaths of infants, often from preventable factors.

html: In Illinois, between 2009 and 2016, an average of 73 women died each year either during childbirth or within one year of their pregnancy – with black women being six times more likely than white women to die of a pregnancy-related complication.
text: In Illinois, between 2009 and 2016, an average of 73 women died each year either during childbirth or within one year of their pregnancy – with black women being six times more likely than white women to die of a pregnancy-related complication.

html: Each year, an estimated 700 to 900 maternal deaths occur in the U.S., with another 70,000 women suffering near-fatal, pregnancy related complications. It is estimated that more than 60% of maternal deaths nationwide are preventable.

html: The 9th Circuit includes 427 of the 573 federally recognized tribal nations. It hears more cases involving tribal issues than any other circuit. It is deeply troubling to see a 9th Circuit nominee like Mr. Miller whose impartiality on tribal legal matters is in question.

html: It's time to put the lives and health of patients first and make life-saving Rx drugs more affordable for working class families across the country. #FLATPricesAct
text: It's time to put the lives and health of patients first and make life-saving Rx drugs more affordable for working class families across the country. #FLATPricesAct

html: Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to stop the abusive pharma companies that dramatically increase prescription drug prices. My bill will target these companies by shortening FDA monopoly periods to bring lower-cost generics to the drug market sooner.pic.twitter.com/1K0uMxCkcZ
text: Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to stop the abusive pharma companies that dramatically increase prescription drug prices. My bill will target these companies by shortening FDA monopoly periods to bring lower-cost generics to the drug market sooner.pic.twitter.com/1K0uMxCkcZ

html: For too long, Big Pharma has been protected from competition by govt-granted monopolies—enabling them to price-gouge patients with ever-higher costs for drugs, like insulin.
text: For too long, Big Pharma has been protected from competition by govt-granted monopolies—enabling them to price-gouge patients with ever-higher costs for drugs, like insulin.

html: There is no reason why essential federal employees should continue to suffer while politicians in Washington bargain a compromise on border security. That is why I voted to reopen the government for two weeks while we continue to debate smart and effective border security.

html: By passing this bill, we will now begin to relieve our overcrowded prisons, redirect funding to our most pressing crime prevention efforts, make our communities safer, and ensure the integrity of our justice system.
text: By passing this bill, we will now begin to relieve our overcrowded prisons, redirect funding to our most pressing crime prevention efforts, make our communities safer, and ensure the integrity of our justice system.

html: The First Step Act was supported by an amazing coalition of unlikely partners – progressive Democrats and conservative Republicans, law enforcement groups and civil rights groups, business leaders and faith-based organizations.
